title: United Nations arms embargo, other sanctions reimposed on Iran
byline: The United Nations reinstated an arms embargo and other sanctions on Iran on Saturday following a process triggered by key European powers that Tehran has warned will be met with a harsh response.

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (28), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Stampede at Vijay’s Karur rally: Death toll rises to 38
byline: The toll from the stampede at actor Vijay’s public rally in Karur has risen to 38, Tamil Nadu DGP G Venkataraman said on Sunday.

title: Cable car accident at Na Uyana Monastery: Death toll rises to 8
byline: The death toll from the cable car accident at the Na Uyana Monastery has risen to eight, after another monk who was receiving treatment in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) succumbed to injuries sustained in the incident.

title: Trump orders deployment of troops to Portland, ICE facilities
byline: U.S. PresidentDonald Trump on Saturday said he was directing the U.S. military to deploy to Portland, Oregon and to protect federal immigration facilities against “domestic terrorists”, saying he was authorizing them to use “full force, if necessary.”

title: Teenage boy dies after being hit by train in Rambukkana
byline: A 14-year-old boy has been killed after being hit by an express train at the Tismalpola railway station in the Rambukkana police division.

title: Two suspects arrested over Rs. 6 mln gold jewelry heist
byline: Two suspects have been arrested in Kiribathgoda in connection with the investigation into the robbery of gold jewelry worth Rs. 6 million after assaulting a person in the Ganemulla Police Division.

title: Vietnam evacuates thousands, shuts airports as Typhoon Bualoi nears
byline: Vietnam closed airports and evacuated thousands of people in potentially affected areas on Sunday (Sep 28) as intensifying Typhoon Bualoi barrelled towards the country, days after causing at least 10 deaths and widespread flooding in the Philippines.
